item.title: Report X-2023040185
item.description:
Report X-2023040185

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-31
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON TORN, WET. UPON INSPECTION INNER CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE WAS 2 x 2.5 GALLONS BOTTLES OF HERCULES ADVANCED. DescribePack: THE 2 BOTTLES MAY OF BEEN TURNED UPSIDE DOWN AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 10% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. THE CAPS APPEARED SECURE AND THE LEAKAGE COULD ONLY BE EXPLAINED THAT THE BOX WAS UPSIDE DOWN WHICH CAUSED THE LEAKAGE. CUST#1003225 ORDER NUMBER 5729979 DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023040152
item.description:
Report X-2023040152

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible signs of internal leakage. The package was placed into a hazmat bag to contain any further leaks and odor for further inspection. Upon inspection, two 2.5 Liter glass bottles were discovered 1 of the 2 bottles containing "Fisher Scientific Toluene" was found cracked causing the internal leakage. The items were placed into a salvage drum to possibly partially scrap and return the remaining to the shipper, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to being dropped during the unloading process. One of the two 2.5 Liters glass bottles was completely cracked, total internal leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed into a hazmat bag upon arrival to contain further leaks and strong odors.

item.title: Report X-2023040127
item.description:
Report X-2023040127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort, we received a blue plastic jerrican at the hazmat cage with what seem to be leakage coming from the bottom. Upon inspection a small puncture was found at the bottom of the jerrican containing "Citromax Natural & Artificial Vanilla Flavor TTB Natural" causing the internal leakage. The package was placed into a hazmat bag to be returned to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was a small puncture at the bottom of the blue plastic 5 gallon jerrican. The puncture was likely caused by a mishap in the unloading process when going through the rollers/belts. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upside down into a salvage bag & drum to stop any further leakage once inspected.

item.title: Report X-2023031257
item.description:
Report X-2023031257

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-25
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible signs of leakage. The package containing "THERMO FISHER SCIENTIFIC ACETIC ACID" was placed into a hazmat bag to contain any further spillage. Upon inspection, the glass bottle was found crushed/cracked into pieces releasing all of its product. The item was then placed into a salvage drum to be scrapped, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was the body. The glass bottle was completely crushed/cracked causing the acetic acid to leak out. The package failure was likely due to be dropped in the unloading process. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The box containing the acetic acid was immediately placed into a hazmat bag to contain any further spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023031093
item.description:
Report X-2023031093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-23
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with wet conditions. Upon inspection, the package was found with 1 of 4 plastic bottles of "SWAN 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL" to be almost leaked out. Loose cap was found to be the cause of the failure. The package was then prepared to be sent back to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap. This caused the bottle to leak out 3/4 of the 99% Isopropyl alcohol. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright in a salvage drum lined with a hazmat plastic bag and the caps were tightened fully.

item.title: Report X-2023031004
item.description:
Report X-2023031004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-17
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING SORT, PACKAGE OBSERVED WET/DAMP.UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, QA IDENTIFIED 1 OF 4 INNER BOTTLES WHICH DEVELOPED A LEAK DUE TO A LOOSE CAP. ADDITIONALLY QA IDENTIFIED THAT THE CONTENT IS A HAZMAT BUT THERE ARE NO HZMT DECAL OR IDENTIFIERS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS AN INNER BOX THAT HAS AN OUTDATED ORMD DECAL BUT AGAIN IT IS OUTDATED AND ALSO ONLY ON THE INNER BOX AND NOT THE OUTER BOX DescribePack: UNSTABLE CAPS OR CLOSURES AND NO HAZMAT DECALS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE IDENTIFIED AS A HAZMAT, THE PACKAGE WA SSEPARATED FROM OTHER PACKAGES AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BIN.

item.title: Report X-2023030952
item.description:
Report X-2023030952

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING SORT PACKAGE OBSERVED RIPPED/TORN W/ INNER CONTENT EXPOSED.INSPECTION CONFIRMED SHIPPER PACKED AEROSOL CANS IN A BOX WITHOUT HZMT DECAL.ALSO, THEY ONLY USED MINIMAL PACKING IN THE FORM OF PAPER AND PLACED IN AN OVERSIZE/ OUT OF PROPORTION BOX. AS A RESULT BOX COULD NOT MAINTAIN STRUCTURE AND GOT CRUSHED AND TORN. INNER CANS SHIFTED INSIDE DUE TO EXCESS ROOM CAUSING THEM TO SMASH TOGETHER AND BREAK OFF NOZZLES. DescribePack: DURING SORT PACKAGE OBSERVED RIPPED/TORN W/ INNER CONTENT EXPOSED.INSPECTION CONFIRMED SHIPPER PACKED AEROSOL CANS IN A BOX WITHOUT HZMT DECAL.ALSO, THEY ONLY USED MINIMAL PACKING IN THE FORM OF PAPER AND PLACED IN AN OVERSIZE/ OUT OF PROPORTION BOX. AS A RESULT BOX COULD NOT MAINTAIN STRUCTURE AND GOT CRUSHED AND TORN. INNER CANS SHIFTED INSIDE DUE TO EXCESS ROOM CAUSING THEM TO SMASH TOGETHER AND BREAK OFF NOZZLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE IDENTIFIED AS A HZMT, THE PACKAGE WAS SEPARATED FROM OTHER PACKAGES IN THE SORT AND PLACED IN A HZMT BIN & BAG FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T00:32:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-16
  • City: CINNAMINSON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 16, 2023, at 1000 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal XCJ experienced a 5-gallon release of UN1263 â€œCerti-Vex AC 1315 Super Seal HGâ€ from a 5- gallon metal drum due to a puncture caused by other freight. No soils, drains, or waterways were impacted. ERTS dispatched Hepaco for cleanup operations. On March 16, 2023, at 1150 ET, Hepaco arrived on site and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to an 8â€™ x 6â€™ area of the trailer floor and a 3â€™ x 3â€™ area of the concrete lot below the trailer. Hepaco confirmed the pail was punctured by adjacent freight. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The empty damaged pail was containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a separate 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 55-Gallon metal drum and a box containing (6) - (16)oz bottles arrived punctured/crushed and leaking. The drum was laying on it's side on the skid and arrived punctured by a piece of dunnage, the box was crushed by the drum. The drum released about (2)gal and the box released about (21)oz. They are holding (1) box containing (3) - smaller boxes impacted by the release from the drum and crushed and leaking. (2) boxes each contain (6) - (16)oz bottles and (1) box contains (4) - (16)oz cans. In total, 2.25 G released. The spill was cleaned. All materials and containers were placed into overpacks for proper disposal.

  • Description: On February 3, 2023, ERTS was contacted by Landstar personnel in Monroe Township, New Jersey regarding the release of Retail Clean-In-Place Oven Cleaner (Potassium hydroxide, solution, UN1814, 8, II) from (1) 2.5-gallon plastic jug, reportedly due to a forklift puncture. The damaged jug, impacted cargo, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (3) 55-gallon plastic drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. Upon inspection, A slight puncture was found towards the bottom of the jerrycan barely noticeable causing a slow internal leakage. This probably came to happen from a small protruding item during the unloading process. The jerrycan was immediately placed into a lined salvage drum to collect and spillage and for further processing. DescribePack: The jerrycan failure was a puncture towards the bottom of the jerrycan. Its a slight gash barely noticeable, which caused a slow leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The jerrycan was immediately placed into a lined salvage drum to collect any spillage. Due to the location of the gash it was impossible of placing the item a way where it can be partially saved.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote and after processing sealed in a salvage drum to contain spillage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 30, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was forked and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental, LLC (FCE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. Then, the crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to containerize all UN1263-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING SORT, BOX IDENTIFIED AS BEING WET, LEAKING, & STRONG ORDOR OF RUBBING ALCOHOL.INSPECTION CONFIRMED THAT INNER CONTAINERS ALL HAD SIGNIFICANTLY LOOSE CAPS.ADDITIONALLY, THE SDS CONFIRMED THAT THIS WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID, HOWEVER THERE ARE NO HZT DECAL ON THE OUTER BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE IDENTIFIED AS A HAZMZAT, THE PACKAGE WAS SEPARATED FROM OTHER PACKAGES AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BIN.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. Upon inspection 1 can containing "Sunnyside Denatured Alcohol, Alcohol Appliance & Marine Stove Fuel" was found with a loose cap causing the can to leak out about half of the product. The package will be returned to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap and the can leaked out half on the "Sunnyside Denatured Alcohol, Alcohol Appliance & Marine Stove Fuel". Loose cap most Likely from the pressure of a drop or it wasn't closed properly by shipper. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright and placed into a salvage bag to ease the effects of leakage. The package was then inspected and found with a loose cap and closed it back up tightly to send back to the shipper unless otherwise.

  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1446 EST, XPO notified ERTS of rejected cargo located at XSD. It was reported that a 375-gallon poly tote of UN2735 â€œ3,3-Methylenebis(5-methyloxazolidine)â€ was rejected by the consignee due to unknown reasons. The Tote was found on OS&D and leaked approximately 1-teaspoon of the product at the spout area due to a possible damaged tote or a seal leak. The terminal requested a contractor out to inspect the tote for damages. ERTS dispatched a contractor for assessment. Contractors arrived onsite and advised were a few drops of liquid under the spout of the tote which they pH tested at a 9. Crew advised it didn't look like there is was damage to the tote. The material was transferred into a new tote as precaution. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110612
item.description:
Report E-2022110612

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-10
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 11/10/2022, at 10:48 hours, CSX personnel in the CSXT Manville yard discovered the SHPX222814, a residue tank car of UN 1993 Waste Flammable Liquid, having a vapor release from the manway area of the rail car. The rail car was isolated and GEOCYCLE was notified along with Kemtell (no report # issued). MEI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the tank car was having a vapor release from the manway area of the rail car. Upon checking the manway gasket. The gasket was found to be improperly installed and cracked. The issue identified where corrected and were communicated to the shipper Marvin Sparks 843-826-1746 marvin.sparks@geocycle.com . Contractor personnel installed new nozzle gasket secured the rail car. The rail car was released to transportation. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1.

  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. The box was wet and breaking apart from being soaked. Upon inspection 1 out of 4 plastic bottles of "Lysol brand I.C. Quaternary Disinfectant Cleaner" was found with a loose cap causing the internal leakage. The package was then placed in a salvage drum to await disposition and to be returned to the sipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to the closure cap of the plastic bottle being loose most likely from being dropped or mishandled. The bottle didn't have any seal so being that it had it loose cap the product leaked out almost entirely leaving only a small amount inside the bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The packaged was immediately placed upright and opened for inspection. Upon inspection the package was placed in a salvage bag and into a salvage drum to await disposition.

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-09
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with obvious signs of internal leakage. Upon inspection, the 5 gallon drum containing "FIBERBOND SPRAY TYPE CEMENT" was found completely covered in product and leaked out covering the drum and the box used to package the item. The lid of the drum seemed to have been out of place leading to cause the internal leakage. The package was placed into a salvage drum lined to await disposition for scrapping, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure is the out of place lid sealing the drum. The package contains a metal lid sealing the drum and seems like the package was dropped causing part of the lid to lift up and cause the complete internal leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright and into a lined salvage drum for further inspection, since the damage came from the top lid area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE MARKED LIMITED QUANTITY. SENT UP MANUAL TOWERS THEN DROPPED DOWN CHUTE AS PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED LEAKING. PACKAGE SAT FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES BEFORE QA WAS NOTIFIED AND DISCOVERED CONTENTS. PLACED ABSORBANT PADS ON FLOOR, PUT ENTIRE PACKAGE INTO PLASTIC BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. BROUGHT TO VENTILATED AREA TO PROCESS, INCLUDING CLEANING MATERIALS. DescribePack: CAPS ON 3 BOTTLES LOOSE AND NEARLY COMING OFF. BOTTLES LEAK STEADILY WHEN TILTED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN FRONT OF FAN TO REDIRECT FUMES WHILE PROCESSING. PUT INSIDE PLASTIC BAG AND RED TOTE THAT WILL BE BROUGHT TO LOCKED HAZMAT CAGE. WORE PPE TO MINIMIZE SKIN EXPOSURE DURING CLEANING.

  • Description: On September 21, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of furfuryl alcohol was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all furfuryl alcohol-impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • City: KEASBEY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. The package was immediately placed into a salvage drum lined with a plastic bag for further inspection. Upon inspection, the package containing "THERMO FISHER ACETONITRILE" was found cracked which caused the internal leakage. The package will be scrapped, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to being most likely dropped as the whole bottle was shattered into pieces causing the acetonitrile to completely leak out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: the package was immediately placed into a salvage drum lined with a hazmat plastic bag upright to inspect right away.

item.title: Report X-2022090924
item.description:
Report X-2022090924

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the Overnight Sort a Hazmat package was brought to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. Upon further inspection the package was place in a hazardous plastic bag then placed in a salvage drum. Further inspection shows that 2 cans of Acetona was damaged, one had a dent that cause leakage the other cap was loose that also caused internal leakage to the package. The remaining contents will be returned to shipper unless told otherwise on disposition. DescribePack: Failure of package was cause by a loose cap on one of the Acetona can causing leakage of 3/4 of the content to spill, also a dent in the other can causing all of the gallon to spill completely. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in a hazardous plastic then placed in a salvage drum to stop further leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. The package was then placed in a salvage drum lined with a plastic bag for further inspection. Upon inspection, one bottle of four containing " SWAN 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL" was found with a loose cap compromising the seal and causing the internal leakage. The package will be returned to the shipper unless told otherwise on disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was caused by a loose cap that compromised the seal on the plastic bottle which caused internal leakage. The bottle leaked about 3/4 of the "SWAN 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL". DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright into a salvage drum lined with a hazmat bag to collect any possible further leakage and further inspection.

  • Description: This fibreboard box was found to have leaked on the belt. It was a UN spec with three spec codes: UN 4G/X33.2/S/2V/USA/M4109, UN4G/Y27.7/S/21/USA/M4109, and UN4G/237.5/S/21/USA/M4109. One of the inner containers leaked approximately 9 L. Exact cause of spill unknown. The package may have dropped during the sort. Standard spill cleanup procedures were followed and the package was contained in a FedEx salvage package (drum) pending final disposition.

  • Description: Two pallets, each containing four 55-gallon metal drums of the above described hazardous material were loaded onto the trailer. Other freight being loaded onto trailer when the trailer floor near one of the pallets of the hazardous material was found to be wet. It appeared that one of the drums ha d been struck by a forklift blade causing a small puncture which resulted in the leak of approximately five (5) gallons Unknown if the drum had been damaged prior to being loaded or if it occurred while other freight was being loaded next the the pallet of haz-mat drums. SAL GRIECO, OS, advised th e spill could be cleaned by 231-VIN employees.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found damaged during the outbound sort and was placed in a hazmat tote. Managers were told about it and QA was notified shortly after. DescribePack: The package was a fiberboard box containing 4 glass bottles of methanol. One bottle broke during transit resulting in spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the moment of the incident, the package was placed in a hazmat tote and absorbent material was used to contain all spillage. The package was brought to the hazmat cage for processing, and after being processed became sealed in a salvage drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMET WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 2X5.58 KG (GLASS BOTTLES) SPRING TERMPTATION 11 BZ 68967. THE TOP PART OF THE GLASS BOTTLE CRACKED. CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 100% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DescribePack: THE TOP PART OF THE GLASS BOTTLE CRACKED WHUCH CAUSED 100 SPILLAGE OF THE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-08
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink (contains UN1210) was crushed during transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior, cargo, and concrete surface beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surfaces, then all impacted material was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: During boarding of UA999, customer [REDACTED] in 49B advised her laptop battery was very hot FA Hookey noted it was an apple MacBook, but unsure of which model Customer was concerned the battery may cause an issue during the flight due to the overheating The FAs who responded obtained the TCB and place the device inside as a precaution. The FAs then notified the International Purser Hookey who then notified the captain A CSR was on the aircraft assisting with boarding and spoke with customer [REDACTED] to obtain all information The FAs handed the TCB to the CSR in the moment MX replaced the TCB prior to departure No other firefighting procedures were needed as no smoke/flames/sparks were present

  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the FedEx Express hub in Newark, NJ a steel drum was observed leaking. Further investigation indicated the drum contained UN3082 Environmentally Hazard Substance Liquid N.O.S. PG III, which the inner contents leaked out from a loose top on the drum. Following the spill cleanup the involved package was placed inside a salvage drum and held pending further disposition.

  • Description: On July 26 at approximately 1200 the sort center ln Newark, NJ encountered a package that was leaking. According to the agent it was dropped on the sort belt. The spill cleanup specialist placed the package in a salvage drum awaiting disposition. DG admin found the SDS for the product and determined that it is UN1263, Paint, 3, PGIII. i

  • Description: A spill agent was called to a sort operation at the Newark hub ror a class 8 spill. The spill agent was told that the fiberboard box containing four plastic bottles had been dropped during the loading process. The drop cause one of the bottles to crack on the bottom. Inside the bottles were separated by a single card board divider and each bottle was in a plastic bag. The package was placed into a steel salvage 1 package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report I-2022090087
item.description:
Report I-2022090087

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-02
  • City: Newark
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE PM SORT OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS HUB IN NEWARK, NJ A PLASTIC JERRICAN WAS OBSERVED LEAKING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE JERRICAN CONTAINED UN3082 ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARD SUBSTANCE LIQUID N.O.S TECHNICAL NAME HEXAMENTHYLINDANOPYRAN, OCTAHYDRO TETRAMETHYL NAPTHALENYL ETHANONE PG II. THE BOTTOM OF THE JERRICAN WAS CRACKED DURING PACKAGE HANDLING AT THE HUB. FOLLOWING SPILL CLEANUP, THE INVOLVED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELD PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION INSTRUCTIONS.

  • Description: On June 29, 2022, at 1200 hours, Mechanical Foreman at the Conrail Eport Yard. Reportedly, the vacuum relief device was leaking vapor and hissing vapor product. The tank car was isolated. The local Consignee Transflo, was notified directly. Marion Environmental Services, a Conrail emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the Eport Yard. Marion found that the VRV was in fact releasing vapor product and would need to be removed and replaced with a plug. FRA granted a verbal approval to move less than one mile to destination for offloading. NARRI: 2x(5+1+0)x(2+0) = 24 Cause code: 1032

item.title: Report E-2022070108
item.description:
Report E-2022070108

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-29
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/29/2021, at 0856 hours, A FRA inspector in the CSXT Manville Yard Manville NJ discovered SHPX 222968, Loaded tank railcars of UN1993 Flammable Liquid (Acetone Toluene) ,having a Vapor release from the vacuum relief devices. The railcars were isolated and National Response Center and the NJ Department of environment were notified. The emergency response telephone number on the waybill was contacted, (CHEMTREC Report # 2022-06-29-00130), and Veolia the shipper of record was notified. Marion Environmental a CSX response contractor was dispatched to the scene and found the vacuum relief device on both railcars having a vapor release. The Vacuum relief device was removed and replaced with a plug securing the release. The release was secured and corrective actions were communicated to the FRA, and the shipper. The railcar was placed on Hazmat hold and will require Shippers MRU to correct the defects. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required?

item.title: Report E-2022060655
item.description:
Report E-2022060655

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-23
  • City: PORT READING
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 23, 2022 at approximately 11:00 New Jersey State DOT Inspector Alan Fisher reported that NATX 310314 was leaking vapor from the vacuum relief at the Port Reading Yard. NATX 310314 was a loaded tank car of UN 1268, Petroleum Distillates (hexane). Conrail Manager of Hazardous Material, Joe Caccamo and Marion Environmental responded to inspect the tank car. It was found that the vacuum relief device was indeed faulty and it was removed and replaced with a blind flange. One Time Movement Approval was obtained to continue to destination and then to home shop for repairs. No further action on Conrail is required. the faulty VRV was sent to: ATTN: Tommy Summers McKenzie Valve & Machining LLC 145 Airport Road McKenzie, TN 38201 cause code 1057 NARRI 2 (5+5+0) X (2+ 0) =40

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-10
  • City: BRANCHBURG
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the delivery destination, a drum of material was discovered to be compromised on the trailer at the top of the drum where the drum chime meets the drum body. The drum was not leaking when sitting still and had shown evidence of leaking approximately 1 ounce of liquid during transit. A hazardous material contractor was called to the scene to wipe down the liquid on the side of the drum and place the drum into an overpack container so it could safely be returned to the destination terminal for disposition. Due to the hazard of material, the package specifications could not be safely obtained. Investigation revealed that the drum had likely been punctured by the tip of a forklift blade at some point during the unloading process.

Cause of damage suspected to be mishap on the overhead conveyor belt, which shouldn't went up, due to the improper handling during the unload process. After proper investigating the package was placed in a tote. DescribePack: Upon further investigation 1 bottle of PARAMOUNT cap was burst open and spilled. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: The cap was sealed back properly which the content and remain will be repacked in salvage drum and ship back to the shipper, unless otherwise on the disposition.
